column8: text

Pakatan Harapan today released its plans for the first 100 days of taking over Putrajaya.Reading the coalition's joint statement, newly-appointed Harapan chairperson Dr Mahathir Mohamad announced that it will abolish the implementation of the Goods and Services Tax (GST), among others.Below is the list of things it plans to do:1.Stabilise the price of petrol 2.Focus on efforts to alleviate the rakyat's burdens 3.Start a thorough reform process of key institutions 4.Fight corruption to its roots 5.Form a royal commission of inquiry (RCI) into the 1MDB scandal 6.Rehabilitate the Federal Land Development Authority (Felda)Two-term limit for PMAnnouncing this alongside its leadership line-up, Mahathir said the coalition is committed to a common goal of toppling the Najib Abdul Razak administration.The announcement was made at a press conference past midnight on Friday at PKR's headquarters in Petaling Jaya.The partner parties DAP, PKR, Parti Amanah Negara and Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia will implement a two-term limit for the prime minister's post.They also agree to "cancel and correct" any breach of laws by the current government, which impact the people's interest."This includes reinstating public funds which were lost through the 1MDB mega scandal," the parties said in a declaration read out by Mahathir.They also agreed to work towards releasing all political prisoners and drop all charges against them, as well as reforming key laws and institutions to prevent abuse of power.Harapan at its meeting finalised its logo and leadership structure after months of negotiations.PKR de facto leader Anwar Ibrahim was announced as the coalition's de facto leader while PKR president Dr Wan Azizah Wan Ismail was appointed as president.https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/388481

How do you define two terms?In the US, one term is four years. But here, election can be held anytime, and new PM can be sworn in anytime between elections.

Lol.   PH is out to sabo all Malaysians!   Taking away GST, when it is not applicable to many basic necessities like in SG, is shifting the tax burden from foreigners to locals and from the rich to the poor.   Other subsidies need to be paid for by more public money. Why do Malaysians like subsidy so much? Buy only what you can afford and leave the subsidies for those who are really poor.

The two term rule shows the stupidity of PH.   Why put such stupid restrictions on yourself?   If a leader is capable, like PM Najib, he should be allowed to run the country as long as he can and wants.   Look at what happened to DAP...   If DAP didn't have this 2-term rule, LGE will just hold another CEC election and kill the allegation of foul play straight away.

Meh. End up you abolish GST and replace with something worse and inefficient. High probability is that they'll be more corrupt than BN to secure their war chest in preparation for next election with cash rich BN if they win this time.Seems that Malaysia got no decent choices in this election.
